Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants meet the tri-partite test for staying a removal order
Evidence_Assessment: Family separation, potential discrimination in Israel, lack of credible threat to life or safety
Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Burden_of_Proof: Applicants must demonstrate all three elements of the tri-partite test
Credibility_Factor: No credible threat to life or safety found by the court
Legal_Rule: Tri-partite test: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) irreparable harm if deported, (3) balance of convenience favors applicant
Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural unfairness in removal process
Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian grounds, family separation, potential discrimination
Outcome_on_Merits: Applicants failed to meet the tri-partite test
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court considered allegations of procedural unfairness but did not find them sufficient
Key_Evidence_Considered: Risk of family separation, conditions in Israel, applicants' ties to Canada
Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law, stay of removal provisions
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking to delay deportation on humanitarian and procedural grounds
Court_Result: Denial of stay, removal order remains in effect
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law tri-partite test applied in immigration context
Evidence_Type: Affidavits, country condition reports, family relationship evidence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), sections related to removal orders
Applicable_Process: Application for stay of removal pending further proceedings
Governing_Rule: Tri-partite test for interlocutory injunction in immigration context
